basics.name: Deng Pan
basics.summary: Postdoctoral Associate at University of Notre Dame. Researcher in Responsible AI, focusing on explainability, fairness, robustness, and security.

work.summary: Collaborating on projects aimed at advancing medical equality in low- and middle-income countries through the application of AI tools, including Large Language Models (LLMs). Enhancing the fairness and transparency of contemporary AI systems by investigating the interpretability and explainability of generative AI models, with a focus on Large Language Models.

Participated in the development of the Ant Model Risk Evaluation system. Designed and developed advanced solutions to enhance security within the Alipay ecosystem, including creating anti-cheating algorithms for online transactions, building a robust risk transaction detection system, and developing algorithms to detect and mitigate malicious accounts.
Assessed assignments and exams, provided guidance to students, and conducted research in areas encompassing recommender systems, explainable AI, Natural Language Processing, and related domains.
Designed interpretable anti-cheat algorithms for transaction sequences.
Worked with a group on the client retention project.

highlights: Dissertation: Interpretable Machine Learning and Applications
